meanings.definition: The state or quality of being oblate.
meanings.sent1: The oblatenesses of the Earth's shape can be seen from space.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the oblatenesses of different planets in our solar system.
meanings.sent3: The oblatenesses of the balloon made it wobble in the air.
meanings.sent4: Her oblatenesses in the dance class made her stand out from the rest.
meanings.sent5: The oblatenesses of the tire caused it to roll unevenly on the road.

meanings.definition: The degree to which a spheroid deviates from a perfect sphere.
meanings.sent1: The oblatenesses of the watermelon made it difficult to cut into perfect slices.
meanings.sent2: Astronomers measure the oblatenesses of celestial bodies to understand their composition.
meanings.sent3: The oblatenesses of the basketball made it bounce in unexpected directions.
meanings.sent4: The oblatenesses of the moon create unique patterns of light and shadow.
meanings.sent5: The oblatenesses of the vase gave it a distinctive and elegant shape.
